result.execSummary:
The defendant Jesse Lee Hermann was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant to pay $50 and costs.  Defendant to pay at the rate of $50 per month commencing 12-1-16 and on the 1st of each month until paid in full.    If not paid, one day in jail for each $40.00 of unpaid fines.
Defendant to pay DNA surcharge.  Defendant to pay in payment plan.    If not paid, one day in jail for each $40.00 of unpaid fines.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
